eventName: Such is the Joy of Our Reunion
storyInfo: In far off Lungmen, Wei Yenwu receives an invitation from the capital, prompting him to recall the turbulent tale of how he departed it. Leizi is brought back to the Judicial Review Office, where the minister Chen Che takes pains to dissuade her from chasing down any more of Blaze's history.

attributes.text: Let someone better take over? Haha, if Father heard that, I'm sure he'd be chewing your head off.
Don't joke with me, Brother. Of all us siblings, who could compare to you in either knowledge or strength?

Once you ascend the throne and move into the Forbidden City, I can leave for the Sky Mirror Pavilion with peace of mind. I'll set up shop as a scribe and look after all Yan's ancient records. In a way, I'll also take some weight off your shoulders.
Brother, no more hesitating! At this point, only you can... convince Father.
The Grand Preceptor... no, all three Grand Ministers support this move! Even in the face of the officers, of Yan's citizens, public opinion will still bear out.
Brother, this is the right thing to do! You can't pull out now!
Why me? Why did it have to be me?!
Our youngest brother died because of you! They all died because of you!
You shove it all on me, make me take the blame alone, deal with the whole warring mess alone, and you just leave like nothing happened?!

attributes.content: Look how idle you are. All the Mid-Autumn festivities of Lungmen, and you don't plan to attend a single one?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Should I? Who wants to see my wrinkly mug on their TV, anyway?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: The Schwires' girl is a planner. She'll handle it. She can make anything lively.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I've watched you grow lazier day after day since we came back from Yumen. You just coop up in your study at home eating snacks. If you don't go out for a walk any time soon, you might just start putting on a beer belly.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Hah hah... I haven't seen Lin Kojui get out much since spring. I can't even find a partner for morning jogs now.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Ah... he's old, I'm old, the young ones know how to do it all. If I keep sticking my head in, they won't think I'm cool.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: So now you understand, huh? If you'd realized any sooner, would little Ch'en have ever left?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: How long ago was it?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Sorry, what?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Little Ch'en. How long has it been since she left?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Five years.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: It's been five years.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: We don't even know what she's going through out there, or how her disease is.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: I know she was at Yumen, when I was there.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: She's doing fine. Her swordsmanship's progressed... so she's fine, I suppose.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: So you just watched her leave again?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: She doesn't want to see me, and she doesn't want to come back. I can't force her.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Don't worry. Her path's longer than ours.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Lord Wei, a letter to you.
attributes.name: Shadow Guard

attributes.content: ...That they made you deliver personally...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: It's from the capital.
attributes.name: Shadow Guard

attributes.content: The sender...?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: His Majesty's Imperial Guard.
attributes.name: Shadow Guard

attributes.content: Did he have any message aside from the letter?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: The True Lung invites Lord Wei to the capital for the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies, and for a moon-viewing together.
attributes.name: Shadow Guard

attributes.content: Leave the letter on my desk. You're dismissed for now.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: If we may ask what Lord Wei intends.
attributes.name: Shadow Guard

attributes.content: I have my own plans. None of you need to worry.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Lord Wei, we volunteer to escort you to the capital!
attributes.name: Shadow Guard

attributes.content: ...I said you're dismissed!
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Why don't we open up your invitation and see what they wrote exactly?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: No need. Just leave it there.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: This day was meant to come. I even thought it'd come a little sooner.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: ...How many years has it been?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Forty... it's been forty whole years since I left Baizao.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Yumen should've reached the capital by now. I suppose my brother's settling all his old debts in one clean go.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: A clean slate in time for autumn... A fine autumn at that.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: You can choose not to go.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: It's been forty years already, what's he going to do? Send another unit of Imperial Guards, a whole army—
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: ...Enough nonsense!
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: At this point, that's not what he intends...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Then what does he intend?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: You know, I've never really brought up those days with him before...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Enough. I don't want to hear it.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Fumizuki, I've let down a lot of people throughout my life...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Edward, my sister, my teacher...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: And I have to admit that my brother's turned out to be one more on the pile.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: You can also say that it was the position that killed so many people.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: ...And who had a choice?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Then it wasn't your fault.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Even if you'd stayed, would things have turned out better? Would there be no blood?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Nobody would have remembered a minister pleading the commoners' case. They would only remember a regicidal, fratricidal prince!
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: If you have questions, ask. I'm in a hurry.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Mind your attitude. You're also a theoretical suspect in our crime scene. But seeing as you're a coworker, I'll spare you the interrogation room.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I told you! I saw the culprit on the scene, I just miscalculated and failed to arrest him—
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Calm down. Are you going to physically vent on me just because you didn't catch the one who did it?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: ...I'd have to match your strength first.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Good. You're still somewhat sober.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: In light of the years we've spent together in the Judicial, then, can you tell me—
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: This afternoon, why were you at Ding Feng Lou, at the scene of the crime?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: ...An investigation.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: In the runup to the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies, we've had the scrollery be burned, then two fires at Ding Feng Lou. Don't you think this string of cases could be connected somehow?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: So you're saying you knew beforehand that someone would set fire to Ding Feng Lou today, and thus you were lying in wait for them?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I was just there following up a lead...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: 'Just' there following up a lead... Do you need me to list off every action you've taken the last few days?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: You've been tailing me?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I don't have that sort of free time... but I have ways of knowing these things, naturally.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Let me ask once more. Who were you meeting at Ding Feng Lou today?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: ...I fear I'm not the only one working on the sly.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Explain?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: For your information, you never told me the Ministry of Rites' files on Gu Quan were forged, and that he was sent to death row before leaving Baizao... As a minister, you must have known these things.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: These are all clearly key points of evidence. Why were they nowhere to be found in the Judicial Review Office archives? And why would you cover up—
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: So this is the lead on the scrollery fire that you've been toiling over for the last few days...? How did you find any of this out?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: It's none of your concern how I found out...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: There is a piece of advice I gave to Yu Cheng in the past, and I will give it to you now.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Some past affairs are learned of. Some are not learned of. In both cases, there are reasons why.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Some things are best left forgotten by all.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I never imagined I'd hear those words come from a minister.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You may consider me a schemer all you like, a minister merely booted over from the Ministry of Justice.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: But I know exactly what I'm saying.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: And I know that regardless of the thousands of reasons you might have, the truth is still and merely the truth, not anyone's tool to broaden the divide.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: There will always be someone who remembers the truth, and the meaning behind it.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: For example, that girl shut in the next room—whom you took every pain to secretly bring back to Baizao all the way from Victoria?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Yes... I did uncover that Gu Quan had a daughter in Victoria. She too can provide vital testimony in the Gu Quan case—
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan, when will you stop playing dumb?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: You've already found out that the Gu Quan files are fake. You know Yu Cheng is on the trail of that very case...
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: So I'm guessing you've also found out about the child who the Imperial Guard brought back forty years ago, who they recorded in the files as deceased... You have your suspicions as to the truth of this case, correct?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Was that girl you brought back here born in Victoria, or born in Baizao?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: You know full well.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: You clearly long suspected her identity, and still, you decided to bring her back. Were you that confident you could pull this off without a hitch...
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Or was it that in pursuit of the 'truth', you didn't even care if she lived or died?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: You're threatening me...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You think I'm joking?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan's gaze fixes tight on the minister's notes. She doesn't even notice how her own attire is soaked through in cold sweat.
But in the next instant, with a bizarre warping of light, the paper in her hands vanishes.
But back on topic, that's not what I care about. At least, right now, it's not what I care about most.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I've told you, past affairs are never as important as present.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: So what are these present affairs of yours?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You know that Yumen is less than a hundred li from Baizao right now. For three months, Baizao has been preparing to split up and move.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: ...And how does this relate to the Gu Quan case?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Should you keep investigating this case, then there will only be one person in all of Yan who can give you your answers.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Qingyan, take one step out of this door, and I can no longer protect you.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: ...Let alone her.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: At the Ch'ens' old place, in the study, there's a secret closet. After I leave, go there, and take what's inside.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Follow those instructions, and you can protect Lungmen's safety, and your own.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: So you're going?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Now's the perfect time to. Kojui's girl is doing a great job handling the downtown, and the Schwires' future doesn't rest on the sick old tiger anymore.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Lungmen doesn't need a Wei Yenwu anymore, or a Chief Executive...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I think you're giving your last words a little too early.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: This is about Lungmen's future... Fumizuki, listen to me...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I've made a lot of mistakes, done a lot of things I regret... but Lungmen, our city, built by us... a home to millions—
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Lungmen must stay.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Then you stay too, and take care of it.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Youngsters can handle it all, but it still needs some oldies to look after it.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: You see this letter too. How am I meant to ignore this?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: So once again you'll just roll over and die? Just like last time you'd pay with your life, is that how you're envisioning it? Does that make anything even?
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: ...It's different this time!
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: There's no one standing on the other side, I'm just facing my own debts.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I made a choice forty years ago... and ever since, with every action I take, I try to convince myself—that even knowing how many people I've failed, I was still right to make that choice.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: But I can't run forever.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: You know, your life's never been yours alone. Not then, and certainly not now.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Forget about sacrificing yourself to make up for anything. You can't make up for a mistake with another mistake—it never ends that way. At our age, we should've already learned that lesson well.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Stay. We'll face this together.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Fumizuki... Don't try and stop me!
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: You cannot stop me... paying for my past.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Well then, you leave me with no other choice.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: While I'm stood here, you're not going anywhere.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Yenwu, this time, I'll protect you. I swear it.
attributes.name: Fumizuki

attributes.content: Leizi!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You're... you're alright?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Of course I'm alright!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: All that Judicial lady asked was what I saw during the fire, and I just told the truth—I didn't see anything! So then she let me go.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: The heck did you do? How come you took so long?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: It's no matter now. Let's go.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Wait, wait, wait! Go? Why?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: That Mo Bufu clearly still has tons of answers! Aren't we gonna follow up with him?!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: There's nothing to follow up on.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Pardon?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I'm not meddling with your father's case anymore.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I'll get you out of Baizao in the next day or two.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan! That's one stupid joke to tell me now, you know that?!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No, wait... you just found a new lead, didn't you? That's why you're just screwing with me?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Okay now, for real, tell me what you found or—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Blaze!
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I got the official debriefing from the Judicial case files.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Gu Quan... an ethnic Yanese from Victoria, joined the Ministry of Rites in 1077 as a ceremonial officer.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Reassigned as envoy of ceremonial rites in 1092, headed for Victoria as part of a diplomatic mission. On the way, encountered an unexpected snowstorm, and passed away after falling into a river.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Leizi... you're lying to me, aren't you...? Just trying to shove me out of the picture again?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You've been asking me just what the deal was with your father's death, haven't you?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Well, every lead's been thoroughly investigated. There's no doubt. That's it, it was just an accident...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: All the gaps in the files have been made replete.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: ...This case can be closed.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: In creeps the mid-autumn. The night sky is moonless.
Out in the streets, the energy poles churn away at max output, but the drop in temperature is still noticeable to some.
All falls still in the dead of night. The human sea recedes. The biting breeze blows through.
Achoo—!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: If you're that cold, just turn on the heater.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Easy for you to say. If we're going to keep running this shabby little eatery, we have to pinch every penny we can on warmth...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Dammit, look how late it is. When will Blaze and her friend show up?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You're wondering about that reward money, huh...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: A... Am not! Achoo—!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Is this window letting air in? I need to fix it later—
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Wait, are they back...?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You... You're—
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: What? Am I not allowed in?
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: P-Please, come inside, I'll put on some tea for you now... Anything to eat?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Noodles. Longevity noodles.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: R... Right, I'll make you some now!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Ones made by your boss.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: W-Well...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Jiang glances back at the staircase where the Young Chef had been standing; by now he's vanished without a trace.
Er... he's out on business.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Then I'll wait for him here.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Far, far out... he won't be back for a fortnight.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: And I'll still wait.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: I've waited thirty years. So long that I'm shriveled up. What's a little longer?
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Chef Mo, please don't joke around now...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You're the first under heaven when it comes to cooking. What could be worth wasting your time here?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Ma de... First under whose heaven?!
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Mo Bufu downs his teacup in one go.
The hot tea spills from the corners of his mouth, and drips down his wizened white beard.

I remember clearly... that winter thirty years ago, a Catastrophe wrecked my home village. Those of us lucky enough to survive took off, me with nothing but my cooking skills. We thought, let's scrape by in Baizao.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: We went through hell. We were almost there when we ran into another group of refugees—or maybe a bandit gang, I'm not sure.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: They followed us for a long way across that icy waste, weapons in hand. We began to realize that they were after the remaining supplies and rations we had left.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: By the time we'd been trekking for a month, plenty of us were sick or hurt. We had barely scraps left to eat, far from enough for both sides to cross that wasteland.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: There was no escape, so we decided we may as well risk it all with them. However, when we were just about to go out fighting, we smelt something delicious. That's when we saw him...
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: There was an old temple not far away from where we were. Someone'd set up a stove by the gateway, boiling up a wok of noodles. We couldn't see his face properly, through all the steam.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: We had no clue why someone would be making noodles there, but we were past the point of wondering, of asking, even of fighting.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: That wonderful smell and those piping hot noodles drew all of us near the wok, and we waited around him quietly.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Never before had I eaten something so delicious...
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: The moment those noodles entered my mouth, I felt like my tongue had been numb for decades, only to spring back to life right then and there.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: All along, I never knew that a meal could taste so arresting, so absorbing.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: It felt like a flavor beyond us humans...
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: By the time I finished my noodles and looked up from my bowl, he was gone.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Who knew that in my lifetime studying as a cook, the most profound lesson I'd learn would be in a shack of a temple outside Baizao City.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: From then on, I apprenticed all over, so that one day, I might make a bowl of noodles like those.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: But I couldn't... In the end, I just can't.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: You know, what if you're misremembering... I mean, look, you were starving at the time, maybe that's why you found that bowl of noodles so tasty—
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Do you not trust my tongue?
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Thirty years a bowl of noodles has been burned into my mind. Thirty years I've been searching for it.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: If whoever that was is still in Baizao, he must be over fifty by now...
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: I searched all over this city. The well-known tea maker in the north, nothing. The guy who made the best pastries in the south, still nothing...
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: I searched and searched, until my fellow oldies in cooking retired, and only I was left. I was on the verge of giving up...
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: But today, once more, I tasted it...
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: I don't know why... her cooking skills were immature, but the noodles she brought forth tasted exactly like it.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: It was your chef here who taught her those noodles, am I right?
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: How do you know...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: We sent out a hundred written invitations for the Ding Feng Lou competition. I can recall every one. I've long been aware your Savors at Yu's had a reputation.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: I don't know what kind of relation your chef and that savior of mine have, and I have no clue why he's willing to waste his talents away like this.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: But I won't do the same... All the cooking skills I've inherited over the years, I can't let them end with me.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Mo Bufu stands, produces a letter from his pocket, and places it on the table.
...You tell him this. That untrained disciple of his? She passes.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Tell her to report to Ding Feng Lou two days later before noon.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: Huh...? She just—passes?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You get good enough business here. Did this doorstep sink again recently?
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: We haven't replaced it in over ten years.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Low doorsteps can't keep the wind out. It's getting colder in the coming days.
attributes.name: Mo Bufu

attributes.content: The boss won't let me. He says the lower, the better. Too high and all the diners will stop coming.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Mo Bufu steps over that low, low doorstep, and disappears into the thick of night.
Once again, the restaurant is empty save for squalls of wind through the hall. Their whistle grows louder, as if lamenting.
...Is he gone?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: *Sigh*... You really are—*Sigh*!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: I heard Blaze passed the test? Does that mean the prize money—
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Forget about the prize money!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: What's wrong with you to torment a man like that... He's seventy, eighty years old, and you'll just watch him freak out like that?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: He just can't find an apprentice to fit him, right? What's to worry about... Look at me, I never worry about things like that.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Put yourself in his shoes, he's spent a lifetime honing his craft, just for it to be lost in a blink—
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Well, if it's lost, it's lost.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Ai—!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: It's his future reputation he cares about right now, it's the title of 'first under heaven' he's carrying, it's others' cuisine he's obsessed with—there's no way he can focus on his own craft and improve it at this rate.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: If he can't make it through this, nobody can help him.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Aiyo, Blaze's back.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Look how late it is, I bet you haven't eaten? I'll go make you something now.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Congrats! I've got good news for you, you passed the Ding Feng Lou exam.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: We'll split the reward money thirty-seventy like we agreed—
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You don't care?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: If you're that good for money, how about leaving your thirty percent of—
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Huh? Xingzhu didn't come back with you?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Right, where's Xingzhu?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Oh, she dropped in this afternoon while Jiang was out buying ingredients. She left you a note too.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Left me a note...?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You have passed the Ding Feng Lou Chef Selection. Please fol—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Oh, whoops, whoops, wrong one. It's this one.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: What could be so secret she has to leave it in a note for you?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: She's... inviting me to her home.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: ...Ning Manor?
attributes.name: Blaze
